GSLB_Pool.title: GSLB_Pool
GSLB_Pool.description: Declares a pool to use for load balancing

resourceRecordType.title: Resource Record (RR) Type
resourceRecordType.description: Specifies the type of resource records for this domain

dynamicRatioEnabled.title: Dynamic Ratio Enabled
dynamicRatioEnabled.description: Specifies whether the system applies a dynamic ratio to the load balancing algorithms for this pool. When enabled, the system treats QOS scores as ratios, and it uses each server or virtual server in proportion to the ratio determined by the QOS calculation.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Specifies whether the pool and its resources are available for load balancing

manualResumeEnabled.title: Manual Resume Enabled
manualResumeEnabled.description: Specifies whether you must manually restart a pool member that goes down

ttl.title: Time-to-Live (TTL)
ttl.description: Specifies the number of seconds the IP address, once found, is valid. Once the time-to-live (TTL) expires, the client has to request the IP address resolution again

verifyMemberEnabled.title: Verify Member Availability Enabled
verifyMemberEnabled.description: Specifies the system verifies the availability of the pool members before sending a connection to those resources

maxAnswersReturned.title: Maximum Number of Answers Returned
maxAnswersReturned.description: Specifies the maximum number of available virtual servers that the system lists in a response

fallbackIP.title: Fallback IP
fallbackIP.description: Specifies the IP address of the server to which the system directs requests when it cannot use one of its pools to do so. Note that the system uses the fallback IP only if you select a fallback load balancing method

members.title: Members
members.description: Specifies the members of this pool

members.title: Members
members.description: Specifies the members of this pool

members.title: Members
members.description: Specifies the members of this pool

members.title: Members
members.description: Specifies the members of this pool

members.title: Members
members.description: Specifies the members of this pool

monitors.title: Monitors
monitors.description: Specifies the health monitors the system uses to determine whether it can use this pool for load balancing

bpsLimit.title: Maximum Bits Per Second
bpsLimit.description: The maximum allowable data throughput rate, in bits per second, for the virtual servers in the pool. If the network traffic volume exceeds this value, the system marks the pool as unavailable

bpsLimitEnabled.title: Maximum Bits Per Second - Limit Enabled
bpsLimitEnabled.description: Enables or disables the maximum Bits Per Second (BPS) option for this pool. The default value is false (disabled)

ppsLimit.title: Maximum Packets Per Second
ppsLimit.description: The maximum allowable data transfer rate, in packets per second, for the virtual servers in the pool. If the network traffic volume exceeds this value, the system marks the pool as unavailable

ppsLimitEnabled.title: Maximum Packets Per Second - Limit Enabled
ppsLimitEnabled.description: Enables or disables the maximum Packets Per Second (PPS) option for this pool. The default value is false (disabled)

connectionsLimit.title: Maximum Current Connections Per Second
connectionsLimit.description: The number of current connections allowed for the virtual servers in the pool. If the current connections exceed this value, the system marks the pool as unavailable

connectionsLimitEnabled.title: Maximum Current Connections Per Second - Limit Enabled
connectionsLimitEnabled.description: Enables or disables the maximum current connections option for this pool. The default value is false (disabled)

qosHitRatio.title: Quality of Service (QOS) Hit Ratio
qosHitRatio.description: Assigns a weight to the Hit Ratio performance factor for the Quality of Service dynamic load balancing mode

qosHops.title: Quality of Service (QOS) Hops
qosHops.description: Assigns a weight to the Hops performance factor for the Quality of Service dynamic load balancing mode

qosKbps.title: Quality of Service (QOS) Kilobytes per Second (Kbps)
qosKbps.description: Assigns a weight to the Kilobytes per Second performance factor for the Quality of Service dynamic load balancing mode

qosLinkCapacity.title: Quality of Service (QOS) Link Capacity
qosLinkCapacity.description: Assigns a weight to the Link Capacity performance factor for the Quality of Service dynamic load balancing mode

qosPacketRate.title: Quality of Service (QOS) Packet Rate
qosPacketRate.description: Assigns a weight to the Packet Rate performance factor for the Quality of Service dynamic load balancing mode

qosRoundTripTime.title: Quality of Service (QOS) Round Trip Time
qosRoundTripTime.description: Assigns a weight to the Round Trip Time performance factor for the Quality of Service dynamic load balancing mode

qosTopology.title: Quality of Service (QOS) Topology
qosTopology.description: Assigns a weight to the Topology performance factor for the Quality of Service dynamic load balancing mode

qosVirtualServerCapacity.title: Quality of Service (QOS) Virtual Server Capacity
qosVirtualServerCapacity.description: Assigns a weight to the Virtual Server performance factor for the Quality of Service dynamic load balancing mode

qosVirtualServerScore.title: Quality of Service (QOS) Virtual Server Score
qosVirtualServerScore.description: Assigns a weight to the Virtual Server Score performance factor for the Quality of Service dynamic load balancing mode

GSLB_Pool_Member_A.title: GSLB Resource Record Type A Pool Member
GSLB_Pool_Member_A.description: Declares member of the GSLB pool

virtualServer.description: Specifies that the Global Traffic Manager assigns connection requests to virtual servers based on a user-defined ranking system.

ratio.title: Ratio
ratio.description: Specifies the ratio weight assigned to the pool member. This weight determines the frequency at which the pool member is selected for load balancing.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: When true (default), the system can use the pool member and its resources for load balancing requests

dependsOn.description: Specifies the name of the virtual server on which this pool member depends.

GSLB_Pool_Member_AAAA.title: GSLB Resource Record Type AAAA Pool Member
GSLB_Pool_Member_AAAA.description: Declares member of the GSLB pool

virtualServer.description: Specifies that the Global Traffic Manager assigns connection requests to virtual servers based on a user-defined ranking system.

ratio.title: Ratio
ratio.description: Specifies the ratio weight assigned to the pool member. This weight determines the frequency at which the pool member is selected for load balancing

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: When true (default), the system can use the pool member and its resources for load balancing requests

dependsOn.description: Specifies the name of the virtual server on which this pool member depends.

GSLB_Pool_Member_CNAME.title: GSLB Resource Record Type CNAME Pool Member
GSLB_Pool_Member_CNAME.description: Declares member of the GSLB pool

ratio.title: Ratio
ratio.description: Specifies the ratio weight assigned to the pool member. This weight determines the frequency at which the pool member is selected for load balancing

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: When true (default), the system can use the pool member and its resources for load balancing requests

domainName.title: Domain Name
domainName.description: Specifies the domain name for this pool member

isDomainNameStatic.title: Static DomainName/ Static Target
isDomainNameStatic.description: Specifies that the member's name specifies a static domain name rather than a name linked to a domain defined on the system. This might be required if the target domainName is not owned by the organization or configured on the BIG-IP. One side-effect of using a static target is that the member is always considered available for load balancing. The default is (false) disabled

GSLB_Pool_Member_MX.title: GSLB Resource Record Type MX Pool Member
GSLB_Pool_Member_MX.description: Declares member of the GSLB pool

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: When true (default), the system can use the pool member and its resources for load balancing requests

domainName.title: Domain Name
domainName.description: Specifies the domain name for this pool member

priority.title: Priority
priority.description: Specifies the MX resource record priority

ratio.title: Ratio
ratio.description: Specifies the ratio weight assigned to the pool member. This weight determines the frequency at which the pool member is selected for load balancing

GSLB_Pool_Member_NAPTR.title: GSLB Resource Record Type MX Pool Member
GSLB_Pool_Member_NAPTR.description: Declares member of the GSLB pool

domainName.title: Domain Name
domainName.description: Specifies the domain name for this pool member

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: When true (default), the system can use the pool member and its resources for load balancing requests

order.title: Order
order.description: Specifies the response resource record's order RDATA field value when this member is picked.

preference.title: Preference
preference.description: Specifies the response resource record's preference RDATA field value when this member is picked.

ratio.title: Ratio
ratio.description: Specifies the ratio weight assigned to the pool member. This weight determines the frequency at which the pool member is selected for load balancing

service.title: Service
service.description: Specifies the response resource record's service RDATA field value when this member is picked.

GSLB_Server.title: GSLB_Server
GSLB_Server.description: Declares a GSLB server object which contains configuration for a load balancer or a host server

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Specifies whether the server is enabled or disabled

serverType.title: Server Type
serverType.description: Specifies the server type. The server type determines the metrics that the system can collect from the server

proberPreferred.title: Prober Preferred
proberPreferred.description: Specifies the type of prober to use to monitor servers defined in this data center. The default value is inside-data-center. Note: Prober pools are not used by the bigip monitor

proberFallback.title: Prober Fallback
proberFallback.description: Specifies the type of prober to use to monitor servers defined in this data center when the preferred type is not available. The default value is any-available

devices.title: Device List
devices.description: Specifies the actual device(s) that are represented by this server object

virtualServers.title: Virtual Server List
virtualServers.description: Specifies the virtual server(s) that are resources on this server object

virtualServerDiscoveryMode.title: Virtual Server Auto Discovery Mode
virtualServerDiscoveryMode.description: Specifies virtual server auto-discovery settings. Use 'enabled' (add, modify, delete), 'enabled-no-delete' (add, modify) or the default 'disabled' (manual configuration)

exposeRouteDomainsEnabled.title: Expose Route Domains Enabled
exposeRouteDomainsEnabled.description: Allows virtual servers from all route domains to be auto-discovered. The default setting is false

monitors.title: Monitor List
monitors.description: Specifies the health monitors the system uses to determine whether it can use this server for load balancing

bpsLimit.title: Maximum Bits Per Second
bpsLimit.description: Specifies the maximum allowable data throughput rate, in bits per second, for the virtual servers on the server. If the network traffic volume exceeds this limit, the system marks the server as unavailable

bpsLimitEnabled.title: Maximum Bits Per Second - Limit Enabled
bpsLimitEnabled.description: Enables or disables the maximum Bits Per Second (BPS) option for the virtual servers on the server. The default value is false (disabled)

ppsLimit.title: Maximum Packets Per Second
ppsLimit.description: The maximum allowable data transfer rate, in packets per second, for the virtual servers on the server. If the network traffic volume exceeds this value, the system marks the server as unavailable

ppsLimitEnabled.title: Maximum Packets Per Second - Limit Enabled
ppsLimitEnabled.description: Enables or disables the maximum Packets Per Second (PPS) option for the virtual servers on the server. The default value is false (disabled)

connectionsLimit.title: Maximum Current Connections Per Second
connectionsLimit.description: The number of current connections allowed for the virtual servers on the server. If the current connections exceed this value, the system marks the server as unavailable

connectionsLimitEnabled.title: Maximum Current Connections Per Second - Limit Enabled
connectionsLimitEnabled.description: Enables or disables the maximum current connections option for the virtual servers on the server. The default value is false (disabled)

cpuUsageLimit.title: Maximum CPU Percent Usage
cpuUsageLimit.description: Specifies the percent of CPU usage. If percent of CPU usage goes above the limit, the system marks the server as unavailable

cpuUsageLimitEnabled.title: Maximum CPU Percent Usage - Limit Enabled
cpuUsageLimitEnabled.description: Enables or disables the CPU Usage limit option for this pool. The default value is false (disabled)

memoryLimit.title: Memory Available (KB)
memoryLimit.description: Specifies the available memory in kilobytes required by the virtual servers on the server. If available memory falls below this limit, the system marks the server as unavailable

memoryLimitEnabled.title: Memory Available - Limit Enabled
memoryLimitEnabled.description: Enables or disables the maximum Bits Per Second (BPS) option for this pool. The default value is false (disabled)

serviceCheckProbeEnabled.title: Path Probe - Enabled
serviceCheckProbeEnabled.description: Specifies whether this BIG-IP device will be used to conduct a service check probe before traffic will be delegated to it. The default value is (true) enabled

pathProbeEnabled.title: Service Check Probe - Enabled
pathProbeEnabled.description: Specifies whether this BIG-IP device will be used to conduct a path probe before traffic will be delegated to it. The default value is (true) enabled

snmpProbeEnabled.title: SNMP Probe - Enabled
snmpProbeEnabled.description: Specifies whether this BIG-IP device will be used to conduct a SNMP probe before traffic will be delegated to it. The default value is (true) enabled

GSLB_Server_Device.description: Configures a device for the GSLB Server

address.title: Address
address.description: Specifies an external (public) address for the device. If BIG-IP DNS configuration synchronization is enabled and all existing addresses for a device are being replaced, new addresses should be added and synchronized before old addresses are removed, otherwise the changes may fail to synchronize. Alternatively, the address configuration changes can be performed on each BIG-IP DNS system

addressTranslation.title: Address Translation
addressTranslation.description: Specifies the internal (private) address that corresponds to the external address

GSLB_Data_Center.title: GSLB_Data_Center
GSLB_Data_Center.description: Declares a GSLB Data Center configuration

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Specifies whether the data center is enabled or disabled

location.title: Location
location.description: Specifies the location of the data center

contact.title: Contact
contact.description: Specifies the name of the administrator or the name of the department that manages the data center

proberPreferred.title: Prober Preferred
proberPreferred.description: Specifies the type of prober to use to monitor servers defined in this data center. The default value is inside-data-center. Note: Prober pools are not used by the bigip monitor

proberFallback.title: Prober Fallback
proberFallback.description: Specifies the type of prober to use to monitor servers defined in this data center when the preferred type is not available. The default value is any-available

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Specifies whether the virtual server is enabled or disabled

port.title: Port
port.description: L4 port for service (like 443 for HTTPS)

address.title: Address
address.description: Format of address for virtual server (such as IPv4)

addressTranslation.title: Address Translation
addressTranslation.description: Specifies the public address that this virtual server translates into when the GSLB provider communicates between the network and the Internet. The default value is disabled

addressTranslationPort.title: Address Translation Port
addressTranslationPort.description: L4 port for service (like 443 for HTTPS)

monitors.title: Monitors
monitors.description: Specifies the health monitors that the system uses to determine whether it can use this linked virtual server for load balancing

name.title: Name
name.description: Specifies the name of the Virtual Server
